head.title: Takeout Upgraded: To Go, Times Two

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel

hedline.hl1: Takeout Upgraded: To Go, Times Two

block.p: A couple of restaurants have embellished their takeout capacity. At Good, 89 Greenwich Avenue (Bank Street), Steven Picker, left, turns his bar into a retail counter at lunchtime, with well-composed sandwiches (tuna, turkey club, mozzarella with roasted pepper and arugula, all $7), salads (roasted pear and cheddar with greens, grilled chicken breast with grilled onions, all $7), drinks, soups, sweets and fruit, all ready to take away: (212) 691-8080.

A couple of restaurants have embellished their takeout capacity. At Good, 89 Greenwich Avenue (Bank Street), Steven Picker, left, turns his bar into a retail counter at lunchtime, with well-composed sandwiches (tuna, turkey club, mozzarella with roasted pepper and arugula, all $7), salads (roasted pear and cheddar with greens, grilled chicken breast with grilled onions, all $7), drinks, soups, sweets and fruit, all ready to take away: (212) 691-8080.

A block or so from Boi, a Vietnamese restaurant on East 44th Street, there is now Boi to Go, 800 Second Avenue (43rd Street). This bright storefront brings banh mi, Vietnamese sandwiches of pâté and ham or chicken on baguettes, to this area of Midtown ($6.95 to $7.75); (212) 681-1122.
